CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {6} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of STEM Subjects relative to the peak of Social Sciences in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  STEM Subjects is to the {right} of the peak of Social Sciences.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Social Sciences show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Social Sciences shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Vocational Training reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Humanities} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =75.8?
EVJ.A: At X =75.8,the label with the highest density is {Physical Education}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 28? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Physical Education}'s peak at {68},{STEM Subjects}'s peak at {82}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks below 31? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.
NF.A: {Vocational Training}'s peak at {12},{Humanities}'s peak at {12},{Social Sciences}'s peak at {14},{Arts}'s peak at {9}

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: STEM Subjects or Physical Education?
NC.A: {STEM Subjects} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Vocational Training or Arts?
NC.A: {Vocational Training} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Arts}
